articles.author: Rajesh Prabhuswamy
articles.description: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to win a record-equalling third consecutive term in office on Tuesday when the 642 million votes cast in the world's largest election are counted.
articles.title: India's Modi eyes biggest win yet when votes counted in giant election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden said Israeli leader Benjamin Netanyahu may be stalling on ending the war in Gaza for political reasons, according to an interview with Time magazine released on Tuesday.
articles.title: Biden says Netanyahu could be prolonging Gaza war for political aims

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy's chief of staff said on Tuesday that using Western weapons to strike inside Russia was a vital decision that would impact Moscow's tactical aviation and its capability to operate in border areas.
articles.title: Ukraine says extending use of Western arms will weaken Russia near border

articles.author: Krishna N. Das, Aftab Ahmed
articles.description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to win a rare third term in office, but a smaller-than-expected mandate means he will have to lean more on his allies for support, and that means urgently addressing issues like unemployment, inflation and economic disparities in the world's most populous nation.
articles.title: A humbled Modi needs allies, and answers to India's unemployment, inflation

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's biggest coalition partner said on Tuesday it would support a prospective deal to free hostages from Hamas captivity even if it entails an overhaul of Israel's Gaza war strategy.
articles.title: Netanyahu's ultra-Orthodox coalition partners back Gaza hostage deal

articles.author: Renee Maltezou, Jonathan Saul
articles.description: Closer international cooperation between naval missions in the Red Sea has reduced the number of attacks by Yemen’s Houthis over the past week, Greek Shipping Minister Christos Stylianides told Reuters in an interview on Tuesday.
articles.title: Houthi Red Sea attacks decline in last week as navies act, Greece says

articles.author: Laura Gottesdiener, Stephen Eisenhammer
articles.description: Claudia Sheinbaum's landslide win gives her an unprecedented mandate in Mexico, but success in handling the country's key ally and trading partner the United States hinges on how she can navigate the relationship and a possible clash if Donald Trump returns to the White House, according to former diplomats and analysts.
articles.title: Mexico's Sheinbaum unlikely to repeat mentor's Trump 'bromance'

articles.author: Karolina Tagaris
articles.description: Ahmed Alkwrab thought his ordeal was over last June when he survived one of the deadliest shipwrecks ever recorded in the Mediterranean Sea and finally set foot on European soil.
articles.title: Exclusive: Egyptian man who survived shipwreck denies causing Greece boat disaster

articles.author: Nellie Peyton
articles.description: The African National Congress was holding high-stakes internal talks on Tuesday about which parties it should approach to form South Africa's next government, with diametrically opposed Marxists and free-marketeers on the menu of options.
articles.title: South Africa's ANC weighs up partners, from free-marketeers to Marxists

articles.author: Michael Blake, Brad Brooks
articles.description: Japanese baseball great Shohei Ohtani's former interpreter pleaded guilty on Tuesday to stealing nearly $17 million from the athlete's bank account to pay off his own gambling debts, according to U.S. prosecutors.
articles.title: Baseball star Ohtani's ex-interpreter pleads guilty to bank fraud
